Reviews.Title: “A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: RogerArscott
Reviews.Content: Late Rooms should be dismembered for calling this place a four star hotel. It is not even third world student gap year standard. It is a rip-off. The prices charged are a scandal. The staff were surly. In fact, other than the location, it has nothing going for it. Keep clear.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here”
Reviews.Author: EDWARD60320
Reviews.Content: Well how late bookings gave this hotel a 4 star rating god only know. Yes it was in knightsbridge and not expensive. The hotel carpets are worn away, the room fuirniture was wron and tatty, I had not hot water, no milk with the tea making facilites, and worse of all , they gave me a room key that was not for my room, which meant that late at night i went into a room to find it occupied, much to the fright of the occupant, Reception said that whilst they gave me the wrong key room number, not to worry as it would actually open the room I should be staying in. So certainly one key opened two rooms!! So if you want to feel safe don't stay here. My Ali [the owner] get your act together.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT 4star as described. Would give it 2star.”
Reviews.Author: Caroline4Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: Arrived late with little time, meeting partner for meal the other side of London which was already pre-booked or would have found another hotel. The new wallpaper was nice but that was it. The toliet didnt flush properly, the door on the bathroom was dirty as were the sheets. The furniture was old. The lift carpet was disgusting. The air-con wasnt cool...And if you think you are getting a breakfast, think again. Fruit bowl consisted of 1 chopped strawberry with 2 tiny cubes of melon. They are charging (sorry, ripping off) Olympic customers by charging £675 per night for a single room, this giving the UK a bad name. Extremely unfair if they get away with this.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine”
Reviews.Author: SweetPeaJackson
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night (business related) on Thursday 1st March 2012. I booked it and then looked at Trip Adviser so was rather nervous as to what I might find ..................... However, for a one or two night business trip this hotel was perfectly fine and I do wonder what people expect sometimes when they book a cheap hotel - my single room cost £87.65 and although not really 4* everything was clean and worked. The photos of the rooms are a little mis-leading as they are not quite that deluxe but my room was number 54 on the fifth floor (v old fashioned lift, although it worked!) and was a good size with a queen sized bed. The bathroom was also a good size and the shower was excellent. TV worked and there was a mini-bar and tea/coffee making equipment. What else do you need? Granted I wouldn't stay here for an occasion of a holiday for a night or two in town for work it was fine and the location is perfect. I went to Starbucks for breakfast so can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even consider it..”
Reviews.Author: katherine h
Reviews.Content: My dad and I booked a twin room for one night at the Knightsbridge Green Hotel as part of our weekend in London. Got to the Hotel, the receptionist's fax machine ''had been on the blick all day'' so our reservation, we made two days previous, had not come through. As to why they have not had it fixed or got reservation details via email etc. we will never know. At first the receptionist was quite blunt and didn't seem to care how many hours we had traveled to find the hotel in the first place. Once we had stood there for the best part of an hour sorting this out, with many phone calls back and forth to Late Rooms (through no fault of theirs- fantastic website), we get our key. Then it just gets worse.. Lift was broken and wasn't fixed for our entire stay there, so we had to trek six flights of longs stair cases whenever we wanted to go in or out (but still with the smallest hope still in our minds we had the key to a fabulous room like we had seen in the advertisement pictures- and why we booked with this hotel). Anything but fabulous.. We unlocked the door, and what to others might not be an issue but is not what we were sold was a shockingly decorated room. Awful curtains and not modern at all. Stayed in better family run B&B's. The we slowly found the following problems.. - Cracks swarmed the 'living area's' ceiling. - 'Living area' was freezing cold- heater wasn't working. - The TV signal was rubbish, kept flickering and sound going off. - Lamp didn't work. - The bathroom door lock didn't work. - Wallpaper was coming off the walls. - Grime round the edge of the bath. - There was no main lights to the room, only lamps which wasn't enough light. - No milk for the tea. - Electrical plugs were tough to plug in our appliances. - Beds were uncomfortable, my dad didn't sleep much at all. - Breakfast is an extra Â£14.99 per person (for a piece of bread and orange juice). Of course we didn't opt for their breakfast; found a lovely cafe 'EAT' around the corner, Â£2.99 for more, nicer food. So, final summation: DON'T book with this hotel. If the problems i've listed above sound acceptable for a room that is up for reservations at Â£890 at a '4*' modern hotel then you need a serious re-think of values. Put a huge dampener on our trip and I really hope no-one has to go through the same disappointment. Best Wishes

Reviews.Title: “Tricked into paying Â£504 for 1 Night at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harry A
Reviews.Content: I had made a booking through an online agent called Late Rooms and/or Asia Rooms for the 3rd and 4th February 2012. The price quoted on the web site before I made the booking was Â£77.28 for the night of 03/02 and Â£99.20 for the night of 04/02. A total charge of Â£176.48. I received a booking confirmation which I did not check as I was confident that this was the price that had been charged. When I arrived at the Hotel I realized that the charge was a great deal more and an amount of Â£581.28 was charged to my card. I raised the matter with the receptionist immediately who said this could not be dealt with until Monday as management was away. On Saturday morning I raised the matter again and was told again to wait until Monday. I checked out of the Hotel on Saturday morning and I released the room back to the Hotel and did not use the facilities on the night of the 04/02. I contacted the Internet booking agent, Late/Asia Rooms, on Monday 06.02.2012 and was informed that immediately prior to me making the booking the Hotel had changed the price. So during the process of making the booking, I had been quoted one price and at the end paid a different higher price, which I had not been made aware of such a change. I requested a refund from the Hotel and the Internet booking agent and both have refused to make any refund. It should also be noted that no services were provide for the 2nd Night of the 04.02.2012 as I had checked out of the Hotel and returned the key before 11 am in the morning. Even so the Hotel refused to refund the payment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ellen S
Reviews.Content: This was definitely a top-notch hotel! We stayed in one of the suites that overlooked Harvey Nichols department store. This area (Knightsbridge) is very nice and has many classy shops and restaurants. The room was spectacular and the customer service was excellent! It was a pretty expensive place, but worth it if you have the money. We wanted to check-in very early due to our jetlag, and they accomodated us right away. Our room was beautiful and extremely comfortable with a nice foyer, large bedroom and lovely marble bathroom. The bed was very comfortable, and the compartmentalized closet made it easy for us to keep all of our clothing organized. The location can't be beat for tourist activities - great shopping across the street with Harvey Nichols and Harrod's, as well as Sloane St., and walking distance to Buckingham Palaceand of course Hyde Park. Continental breakfast was included in our rate, and was a pleasure to wake up to each morning - the room service staff was so friendly and thoughtful. The room was expensive, but London is an expensive city. There is also construction going on next door (in fact they arebuilding a new 6 star hotel in London named Bvlgari), which did not disturb us in any way. Ellen S., USA

Reviews.Title: “If this is four star I'm Donald Duck.”
Reviews.Author: Gerry_D783
Reviews.Content: dirty lift, no secure lock on door, cigarette burns in bedding, less than half a roll of toilet paper, torn lino, peeling walls, cold tap seized (but hot water only tepid, so no problem there) no hangers, wi fi, cable/sky, mini-bar or room-service. Trouser press fell off wall when I tried to open it; hair drier split and unusable. Unless you like student digs, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking conditions, what a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: Taras V
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at Knightsbridge Green hotel- can confidently say that is the worst place I have ever stayed at.. "4 stars boutique hotel" What a lough! When arrived, hotel insisted on payment upfront, and only when I got into the room I understood why... Room - absolutely shocking (see pictures): - paint pealing from the wall, - broken lights, - broken sockets, - stained carpet, - stained walls - TV not working - no hangers - broken chair - broken fridge when spoke to receptionist, she agreed to change the room for me but only the next day as hotel was full. 2nd room - not much different. Breakfast: 2 cold hard crousants + coffee - a cup of hot water with a pack of instant Necaffe original on the side.. And the list can go on and on...

Reviews.Title: “Great location,excellent customer service, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Leyla86
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner just stayed in the Knightsbridge Green hotel and it was magnificent-very friendly staff, quick check in, great room with excellent city view, comfy large bed, nice toileteries, good water pressure, and a good quality bedding. It is literally in the heart of the city. I could have reached Harvey Nichols and Harrods in a minute. Shopping was amazing..Topshop Zara etc...a minute far. We will definitely return to this hotel. Great lobby too!!! Floor looked somewhat of an art piece! Thank you for your kindness staff for upgrading us!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Missmandarin
Reviews.Content: We made the mistake of reading the reviews the night before we stayed at this hotel. Goats in the shower, mushrooms growing on the floor - we were worried to say the least. However, upon arrival, the lobby was clean so we had high hopes. Ahead of us was a couple who had travelled from Dubai to stay. The husband had disappeared up to the room, leaving the wife to get the bags into the old fashioned lift, no help was offered by reception, she couldn't physically hold the door open and get her bags in so I volunteered my help. I thought it was bad that reception offered no help at all! Got to our room - was pleasantly surprised! Clean, modern decor etc. however, all bar one of the lights didn't work, and one of the lights was actually hanging off the wall. The walls in the bathroom were grubby looking and the ceiling in the bathroom was in need of repair. The location is great and I would not agree with the majority of the reviews on here. We enjoyed our sta here, and for Â£77 for the night we certainly couldn't grumble.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Risk It”
Reviews.Author: nick f
Reviews.Content: I moved to this hotel after staying at a rather shabby but adequate hotel in another part of London. To my cost I did not read trip advisor first. The room I was allocated was excellant on first impression with a kitchen and substantial bathroom, plus a table and chairs for suitable for work. However on closer inspection there were some significant issues - backs missing off plugs and loose wires, fire hazard !! No cold water in the bathroom sink, had to brush teeth in kitchen ! Two single beds pushed together as a double, not good if I had been with the missus. The main issue was the breakfast - no joke the continental breakfast consisted of 2 cold slices of toast, max pax hot chocalate, two tablespoons of granola and a Muller yoghurt. This was advertised as luxury and for Â£14.50 it should have been. Then on checkout I was charged for this rubbish having been told on arrival that it was included in the cost of the room. The hotel is in a great location and could be amazing given some TLC and a change in the ownership - but at the moment don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Kevin F
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a special birthday treat for my wife. Thinking it was a four star hotel. Well I can tell you it is a nice location but that's all that can be said for it. It is run down and in need of desperate tlc. It does have potential but needs work done urgently. Thank god we were only there for a couple of days. Breakfast I have had better at a Formula one motel. Please just dont go there you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “What is all the fuss about??”
Reviews.Author: Joe H
Reviews.Content: Having booked one night at this hotel online I had a look at the reviews the night before I was due to check in. I was quite frankly terrified having never seen quite such appalling reviews for a hotel. So it was with some trepidation that I headed to the hotel the next day. But all my fears were quite unfounded. I found the staff friendly and helpful. The room was clean and tidy and ready for us at 1.30pm. I paid a little over 100GBP for the twin room in a hotel that is only a minute away from both Harrods and Knightsbridge tube. Yes the hotel is definitely not 4-star luxury as stated on the website but then what would you expect from a hotel so cheap in such a upmarket area?? Overall my stay was fine and I was able to enjoy the rest of my trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Earth!! Shame to have this hotel in London!”
Reviews.Author: Timothy S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst hotel experience and worst managerment I have even had and ever seem (yes, Mr Ali and Andriana, I am talking about you). If you have even single sec to goto this hotel, please don't and read my experience below. I saw on web they have room wifi service so I booked it. To play safe, I called them to confirm room wifi service. Their reception told me room wifi service does not work so I ask them to cancel my booking. They told me they check the system and the credit card hasn't been charged and ask me do not need to worry. To be extra careful, I ask them to reply me in email cos I want to book another hotel. They reply me and I think I am safe. After I back from holiday, I found my credit card is charged. So I tried to contact them by emails for two weeks. Simply there was no reply. So I start to made international call and call them for one week. Day 1: Their receiption told me their manager need one day to make decision. Day 2: They said their manager needs another day. Day 3: They said their decision maker, Miss Andriana will call me back in half hour. After few hours, I call them again and they said she has already gone home. Day 4: They said she is no in hotel today and will back tmr. Day 5: She is no in today. Day 6-7: She is not in hotel over the weekend. Day 8: Their manager Mr Ali is making decision. I asked my friend lives in London to have face to face meeting with them and they use the same trick to avoid it. Having said that, if you have similar experience, simply call your credit card company to dispute the charge as they management is so hopeless and they only try to buy time and charge your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Unratable. DODGY HOTEL! AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: readit101
Reviews.Content: Where do I start.....! My first mistake was thinking that I was going to the hotel in the pictures!! Where they got these pictures from, god only knows as it sure as hell wasn't at the Knightsbridge Green Hotel. There is no way on earth that this hotel is 4 star and I will be querying this direct. The hotel is possibly 2 star and that's being generous. The hotel is grubby and very worn and I wouldn't even class it as a hostel! The staff are rude and have no idea of customer service. We skipped breakfast the second day as it really wasnt worth having. No fresh coffee just a nescafe sachet, very cold thin sliced toast and a cut up apple and kiwi. In the room there was half a toilet roll and no milk at all. The location is greAt but it really does not compensate this rat infested hole. Please read previous reviews as I wish I had!!! The hotel is a con artist and we were glad to get out of there. Avoid at all costs, I just wish I had. I will probably have Scabies as a result!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be shut down”
Reviews.Author: Abc123186273
Reviews.Content: I booked today 23.11.2011 for tonight the price was Â£890 reduced to Â£99 late rooms, we arrived late,received our key, went to the room-and left immediately.asking for a refund with no joy.they said unable to give refund on cancellation, I explained I am here in person and have not cancelled,i am simple not satisfied they told me to take it up with late rooms.the hotel needs shutting down,filth.Anne Robinson needs to be addressed

Reviews.Title: “Has not been maintained since WW 2.”
Reviews.Author: ZWK
Reviews.Content: Needs a major face lift. Too expensive for what it offers . Staff too valuable and too nice to work for such a property . Owner irresponsible vis a vis the reputation of London tourism and it's guests. After all these reviews hotel should be shut down until refurbished unless prices are reduced by 50 %.

Reviews.Title: “Just call yourself 3star basic not 4 star luxury”
Reviews.Author: spags4
Reviews.Content: For shopping, museums and royal Albert hall this is a fantastic location however it is not and no where near a 4 star luxury hotel as it describes itself. Our room was very basic yet relatively comfortable.. Bit like a travelodge and as we paid less than Â£100 then for its location then fine. Located on a busy road meant a lot of noise so take your ear plugs! Room was clear but needed a lick of paint. Breakfast was delivered on time to the room and was of reasonable quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star luxury plus hotel”
Reviews.Author: 186332Charlotte73
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this hotel for a romantic weekend break. The only positive thing i can say about this hotel is the staff were friendly. The hotel was rated as a four star luxury plus, the carpets are thread bare, rooms are dark and dingy unable to open any windows, lightbulbs not working, furniture is tatty and belongs in a skip, wallpaper that must have been put on by a blind person, in the bathroom the shower drips rather than runs and the toilet needs to be flushed four times to flush at all. I specifically requested a double room and got twin beds pushed together and the breakfast is not worth ordering as the staff forget half of the order which is quite ridiculous seeming its a continental breakfast, i have a dairy allergy and so could only eat the fruit salad which the first morning we had to phone the reception, when it eventually appeared it was 3 slices of banana and 3 grapes, on the second day the fruit once again didnt materialise so did the only sensible thing and went elsewhere for breakfast. This hotel is NOT luxury it may be sufficient for a backpacker but DO NOT choose for a romantic break as tears will be involved.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as we thought it would be!”
Reviews.Author: Karen W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just stayed at this hotel for a sight seeing London break. The location was fantastic however the hotel was certainly not 4 Star as stated on the Website. We made the mistake of booking this hotel prior to reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and since we made an Advance Booking could not cancel without losing our money! However it was not as bad as we thought it would be considering some of the reviews we had read. Upon arrival they had no record of our booking (which we were not surprised at as reading the reveiws seems a common problem) however the staff were ever so polite and sorted us out a room (an upgrade apparently). The room was clean and tidy but not what I would expect of a Four Star Hotel. If you are looking for a luxurious romantic get away I would certainly not pick this hotel but for a touring break of London and for somewhere to rest your head at night it is ideal. However do book in advance if you do choose this hotel as the room rate that was advertised in reception was very expensive and certainly would give you something to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel In Hell!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan S
Reviews.Content: Do not consider this hotel for one moment. My wife and I booked and paid for 1 night's stay through Last Minute.com because of it's location in Knightsbridge. We were told where our room was and eventually the lift came and took us to a dirty, dark and dingy room with net curtains that could never have seen soap. We left immediately, loosing our money, and checked into The Millenium Hotel in Sloane St. It was worth loosing our money and paying extra to be in a clean hotel rather than something more akin to a homeless shelter. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

Reviews.Title: “Note nearly as bad as people make out.”
Reviews.Author: Gus S
Reviews.Content: Aside from the bizarre room layout and the tired carpets and paintwork the room was clean and comfortable. We had everything we needed for a restful nights sleep and a shower the next morning. Was it worth the money? of course not. But then you have to take the location into account, its literally a 3 min walk from Harrods. I had booked the room and then read the abysmal reviews on Trip Advisor so expected the absolute worst. First of all let me address the lift, its one of the old time lifts and the doors want to close all the time, they are spring loaded we had luggage and yes it was a pin that they wanted to close but dangerous? no. Only if you are in the habit of sticking your hands into machinery would it become dangerous. The Staff were very friendly and when we asked for an ironing board they were more than happy to bring it to the room. As I have said, the room was clean if a little tired. Was it 4*? no way, maybe 2*, was it worth the Â£231 a night we paid, no way. But given the location, are you really going to get better? I doubt it. I would stay there again if I could get a better price, at the end of the day I went there fearing the absolute worst and was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Worst than hotels in the third world country”
Reviews.Author: Rick K
Reviews.Content: I wish to express my bad experience with the Knightsbridge Green hotel and wish someone to do something about it. I was booking the hotel online and paid by VISA card for 2 nights stay from France on 5 Oct 2011. The cost for 2 nights stay ( 6 - 7 Oct 2011) was 241. 92 Pounds. I arrived in London on 6 Oct 2011 and checked in the hotel at 1:00 pm but the room was not ready until 5:00 pm. One of the hotel receptionists to checked me in as she told me that the person who booked the hotel for me wasn't me, so I had to redo the transaction again so that she will allow me to check in. I have never heard of this before. I did not have access to the internet at that time but when I came back to France I checked my bank statement which showed that the hotel had double charged me. The following day I called the hotel in regard to the double charges to get my refund back, however the hotel staff refused to repond. Before I left Rome to Australia I called the hotel staff and I received no response. I have also sent numerous emails to the hotel from Australia I have again received no response.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicki B
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel to celebrate our anniversary without checking on here first. Having checked I was dreading our two nights at the hotel. However, the room was very nice, particularly as we were upgraded to a suite. The decoration needed updating but was adequate. There was a lack of water in the shower which may have been taking their green credentials a step too far! Staff were fine, smiley and friendly. Sheets and towels were clean as was the room. If you have an option don't bother with breakfast Harrods offers considerably better value! Position fantastic, 5 minutes walk from Harrods and The Mandarin Oriental for Dinner. Not my definition of a 4 star hotel but compared to thousands for a suite at the Mandarin Oriental a bit of a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “APPALLING & DIRTY - Do NOT stay at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: michele n
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 22 Oct 2011 (booked through Late Rooms, where it is classified as a 4 star plus). This hotel is dirty, rundown, has a dangerous lift, no restaurant, no dining area, no hot water, no wi-fi. Breakfast (left on a dirty tray outside your bedroom) consists cold/weak coffee, eggcup of cheapest cornflakes, warm out-of-date yoghurt, 1 slice of toast. No manager is ever onsite to address complaints to (we counted 32 separate guests trying to complain). Our room (supposedly a luxury double) has stained carpets & bed linen, burnt out eletrical fittings, mould and water damaged bathroom, threadbare towels and NO hot water for our entire stay! Redress was impossible as no manager was available - we were told by reception to email the owner. Late Rooms allow this hotel to selfclassify itself as 4*plus - this is outrageous. Give the condition & servies available, this hotel is LESS than 1 star. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “A great find.”
Reviews.Author: AntonNottingham
Reviews.Content: I read very negative reports about this hotel AFTER i had booked and paid in advance for my room and was a little nervous on arrival last night..However I could not have been more pleased and surprised. Reception staff were very friendly and my room was terrific. i was actually given more of a suite than a room ( room 23 )- large double bedroom, comfortable bed, lounge with flat screen TV. Dimmer switches all round. Perfectly OK bathroom. Large towells. Everthing spotlessly clean. In fact I was told that most of the rooms are suites of varying sizes. Continental breakfast served in my room was fine and turned up on the dot. OK, the carpet in the curiously pink lift is a bit stained but I wasn't sleeping in the lift- just who are these complainants !!. A four minute walk from Harrods, three minutes from Knightsbridge underground - and one of the most delightful French bistros in London - Chabrot , in the walkway just round the corner. PERFECT. From Tony, Nottingham

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT (In My Opinion) a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: weimeranerMansfield
Reviews.Content: Location was the main reason we chose this hotel - I should have taken more note of the previous reviews because this place should be avoided at all costs! Dirty bed linen was just the start - bloody fingerprints on the wall was the final straw! We raised concerns with the staff who were not interested and 7 hours after we arrived - still had not cleaned the blood stains from the wall. How on earth they can claim to be a 4 Star establishment is beyond me and although we paid in advance we were very close to walking out. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor, not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patreacle
Reviews.Content: This place is very poor for the area so don't be fooled Firstly there is no wifi. The rooms are very dirty, see photos they say it all. For Â£14:50 the breakfast is terrible - cold toast, cornflakes with no milk and a portion of jam We asked to be moved due to the hot water being luke warm in our first room, one cannot help but feel the staff are used to the complaints by the way they responded, they did move us in the end but the new room was filthy. The whole place is showing signs of neglect, You can get better for your bucks. To be fair the web site / hotel should be done under the trade descritions act this place does not do as it says on the tin. If I owned Harrods I would forbid this hotel using my store to advertise, it is very poor We were informed by a member of staff that Mr Ali, the owner of this hotel is running it down.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: sodasan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Knightsbridge Green Hotel for one night on a business trip in September 2011. If it was not for the name you would not think it is the same place that you saw on the website at home. There is no lobby, no restaurant, no bar. The paint is literally crumbling from the walls, the carpets are well faded and have massive holes. The rooms are no frills, spacious but rather unfriendly and the run down atmosphere continues here. And - big downer - there was no hot (or warm) water in the morning! They were reasonably clean though. The street in front is rather noisy so prepare to be woken up by a couple of police cars chasing down the road during the nights. Wireless was not available on the rooms as promised but only on the "lobby". The breakfast - an the absence of a lobby - is served in the room but not worth mentioning. Don't expect butter or jam or other luxuries. The two points rating is only for the very friendly staff who are seemingly trying to make up for the bad state the place is in. I cannot recommend to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Please stop advertising this place as a 4* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sammy_3007
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" has a great location therefore the price is quite high, but don't be fooled by the nice photos on their website - it'a a pretty average guest house and shouldn't be advertised as a luxury hotel. There's no lobby nor restaurant - really basic breakfast (read: stale croissant and cheap cereal) is served in the room. The rooms were not bad at all - quite old fashioned and tired but clean. I think most of the bad reviews are caused by the misleading description of this place and hence - disapointment on arrival (starting from strange "lobby" - feels like you're sitting in a shop window amongst a display of cupcakes!) I paid 134 pounds a night so not that much for a B&B in this part of London but the rate displayed in hotel's reception was 395 per single room a night!! That's a scam, you would never want to pay that much for a room there. You can get a room in the Savoy for that :)

Reviews.Title: “worst experiance ever ** please stay away***”
Reviews.Author: MIssyKNic
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again, they have lost my payment and are still trying to sort it out, the staff were unhelpful, the manager was unavailable. IN the end the only way to sort the problem was to make another payment to the hotel (by MY MOTHER WHO I HAD TO CALL BECAUSE THEY WERE SO USLESS - i made my original payment to them in JULY!!!!! it completly ruined my weekend down in London. Moving onto the room, it was falling apart it had paint and plaster missing from the wall, the curtains were not even the same length and something was growing out of the celing. when i contacted reception all i was told was that they were aware of the situation

Reviews.Title: “Hugely disappointing - definitely not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: KittyMonty
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel many years ago and it was a lovely little boutique hotel. What a difference now. It's run down, smelly, poorly equipped and dirty. We had no hot water in our room the entire four days we stayed, and the staff couldn't care less. Also, after reading previous reviews, we had called to check that the wifi was working in the rooms, and were promised that it was being sorted out, and it would be fine by the time we arrived. But when we got there, it wasn't working - apparently it had been working the day before, but had stopped - what a coincidence!! I can't believe it is allowed to call itself 4 star - it is 2 star at best. The only thing it has going for it is th locution, and that doesn't out weigh the grime, carelessness and downright gloom of this hotel. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emma D
Reviews.Content: Warning to anyone who goes to this hotel, advirtised at 4 star, this is not the case. No mini bar even in a suit room, no iron, a double room had 2 mattresses pushed together, wall paper peeling off, no breakfast when request and the worst customer service I have ever experienced at a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Please stay away”
Reviews.Author: 84artemis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOT 4* Luxury as billed and the website is terribly misleading, this is 2* at best. I was put in room 10, when I was handed the room key this even looked suspect, on entering the room they was a funny musty smell, the bed sheets appeared to be clean, but what suprised me first of all was to find a mini fridge planted between 2 chairs for no reason. The bathroom floor was peeling off and everything just looked very tired. The breakfast menu was a photocopied piece of paper and 'luxurious' was not a word that crossed my mind at any point during my very brief time here.. When I asked staff why they bill themselves as 4* I was told it was because of the location. I was offered one alternative room (#11) and this was just as bad. Echoing other reviews, when I asked to speak to the manager I was told they were unavailable and reception could only authorise check ins. When speaking to the receptionist you could see that this conversation had happened too many times before. This is the first hotel I have been to that has had no managerial team of any description. Throughly dissapointing for what was meant to be a pleasant stay in Knightsbridge. Quite staggering to think when there is a Rolex, Mclaren shop down the road and Harrods round corner...

Reviews.Title: “Knightsbridge Green Hotel - Not 4* but a nice 3*”
Reviews.Author: p_s_carpenter
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, pretty good hotel. We had a bit of a snafu with the booking through easytobook.com and ended up having the reservation cancelled...which we didn't find out about until we got there at 7p after travelling all day from Paris. The staff were very helpful in a stressful situation. We got *A* room but not *THE* room we were supposed. It was a "Single-Double" vs the "Double-Double" we paid for but they moved us to the MUCH bigger D-D room the next day. Which was great...untill the A/C didn't work. The staff addressed immediately by moving us again (pain in the butt having to repack up) -- INTO A SUITE!!! -- which we kept the duration of our week-long trip. The location of the hotel is excellent -- about 5m from the Knightsbridge tube stop and right across the street from the South edge of Hyde Park. This is a VERY POSH area of London; right across from the Rolex store and McLarran dealership; the Ferrari dealer is around the corner; a ton of boutiques, Gap, H&M, and Harrod's are all no more than 5m walk. Starbucks is around the corner; too many eateries to count, and security...I've never seen so many cops patrolling (and London has a ton of them). This was literally the day after the N. London riots so I'm guessing they were precautionary, but still, it is VERY SAFE. In addition, there are TWO pubs (they are chain pubs but nonetheless 2 of them!) right next door, annd another around the corner offering pretty good English food (I'm American and don't know whether it's "proper British food" but was what I expected) and decent rates. We also had dinner at the Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park Hotel and it was excellent without being overly pricey (on par with- though cheaper than a night at Morton's). Be advised: The hotel is currently being renovated. There was no obvious work going on while we visited but you can definitely tell that there are some areas that are in need of TLC. The rooms themselves were fairly modern. The furnishings are IKEA (i.e., they good but are not of the best quality) and have a very modern feel. As I mentioned the A/C units are in the process of being replaced -- the 1st and 3rd rooms had no problems. The bathrooms are spacious, offer full bathtubs with showers overhead and plenty of counter-space. The beds were fairly comfortable, above-average. The biggest down-side to this hotel is the internet. They have the router in the basement and the only place you can get wifi is in the lobby/lounge. VERY inconvenient for anyone NEEDING the internet extensively during their visit. There is limited space in this area as well. The other thing is that the internet has a tendency to drop off. A call to The Geek Squad would probably fix this issue but for whatever reason, it had not been done as of my check out. I am fairly meticulous about reading/ analyzing the reviews before booking and I did see some unfavorable reviews (or maybe "less desirable" is better). I would honestly say most of them seemed to be pretty over-blown based on my experience. For the rate we paid (about $150 US -- in AUG 2011), we totally got our money's worth -- even had we not gotten the suite. I have stayed in London before (in 2003 at a Holiday Inn near the British Museum) and this hotel was on par with the other place though the other place had a restaurant area (never did see -- or ask about eating at this place). Probably not a true 4-star hotel, but definitely 3+. I will definitely try to score a room here next summer for the Olympics. I highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much - cheap, central, but poor in many ways”
Reviews.Author: Tony C
Reviews.Content: Pros - great central location. My room was clean and had no problems I couldn't live with. Staff were friendly & helpful during my stay (August 2011) Cons - I ran the shower for 10 minutes before I got any hot water on both days I stayed. The street is quite noisy from about 6am so if you're a light sleeper you'd better enjoy getting up early. Breakfast was 15 mins late (I had a meeting to get to) very basic & served in my room (no restaurant). The toast was floppy.

Reviews.Title: “Defiantly not what is advertised”
Reviews.Author: L0ttie123
Reviews.Content: As did the last reviewer, I booked this hotel through Late Rooms and did not read the reviews until after booking. I will never make this mistake again. After being seriously concerned about this hotel I tried to cancel and even tried to cancel the transaction on my credit card, but it was too late. I can honestly say i wasnt expecting much from this hotel. I was very surprised at the superb location, but felt like i was a booking into a hotel which was catered for and run by students. Not quite what was advertised. (4 star plus luxurious contempary hotel - NOT) We we right up on the 5th floor, even though they hardly had any guests. We had a double room, with a lounge area too. It was just very basic, with an empty fridge plonked on the foor next to a tv, on a filthy glass stand. The decor was very dated, but seemed clean. The bedroom was basic with a bed, the most inportant thing was that the sheets were clean. The bathroom needed ripping out and starting from scratch. The walls had coffee marks up them and there was hair on the shower wall. Not really very relaxing. The bed was comfy enough but i just couldnt sleep. There is no resturant or bar, and they say breakfast is delivered to your room. They asked us to fill out our breakfast choices and hang on the door. They had photocopied a door hanger with these options on and had torn the A4 piece of paper into 2. I would have had to either cut a hole in the paper or torn it. I decided i would rather not have the breakfast as going by the look of the hotel i wasnt expecting much. I have certainly learnt from my mistakes. This hotel is fine if you are not fussy but certainly not what i was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Was concerned after reading the reviews - but was very surprised!”
Reviews.Author: LORNA S
Reviews.Content: Booked through Late rooms - then I read the reviews - I thought I should have read the reviews first - but to fair, I wouldn't have booked this hotel - however, I am glad I booked it first as the hotel was lovely. Only 100m from Harrods, but tucked away enough to be quiet at night. The location was brilliant. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel was spotless. It is an old building and shows some signs of its age, but the room we stayed in was lovely; spacious and very clean. I payed 130.00 for a twin room for one night and I really did feel that I had found myself a brilliant deal - top tip - ring the hotel before hand and politely ask the staff to make sure you have a nice room. It worked for me anyway - very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fancy a nice hotel? Then steer clear of this one!!”
Reviews.Author: IrishHM
Reviews.Content: Ladies and gentlemen, let me begin this review by saying that I have never submitted a review on Trip Advisor but after my experience in the Knightsbridge Green Hotel I felt it was necessary! Good Points: 1. Friendly Staff 2. Location is excellent 3. Checking out! Bad Points: 1. Staff lied to me about two issues - Wi-Fi in the hotel and availability of other rooms (a part time member of staff told me there were plenty rooms free while I was there). 2. This is a guest house, not a hotel - no bar, no dining room etc. 2. Wi-Fi was advertised in each room, there was none. One member of staff told me it not working in my room and it would be repaired later that day. The following day I mentioned it to reception again that it still wasn't working - listen to this - a different member of staff said - "ok I'll be honest with you, it will be fixed on Thursday". I was due to check out on Wednesday - how convenient! Three nights without any Wi-Fi. I was told that I could use it in the lobby, but guess what? The router was so old and therfore the signal was so bad I gave up browsing the internet in the "hotel". I used an internet cafe each day instead. 3. They had some large towels crumpled up on the carpet in my bedroom that were catching serious drips coming from the air conditioning unit when it was in operation. 4. The walls in the bathroom were filthy, I mean with grime and lots of old stains like shampoo splatters and toothpaste (painted walls) 5. The white light fitting in the bathroom buzzed constantly obviously due to faulty wiring and the light fitting was blackened around the bulbs from previous shorts or maybe the bulbs blowing. 6. Television - the most frustrating television set up I have ever come across, a member of staff came up to fix it and while he was there I asked him why is this place so poor. He said it was bought by someone who just let it go to rack and ruin, and that they were quite used to people complaining. He fixed the television for me (for your information I am in my 30's and I am quite competent when it comes to programming tvs etc but this tested my skills!!). 7. The coving in the ceiling was in very bad shape, the carpet was not vacuumed properly, lots of dust around the headboard of the bed. 8. "Breakfast" - delivered to your room - cold toast, yogurt was like out of date cream, milk was ok as it was in a packet, cereal was fine as it was out of a packet. It was a terrible breakfast, I only had it one morning. Please do not fall for the fantastic website with the luxurious photos of their bedrooms, this is an awful awful place to stay. If you are on a stag in London this might do but if you are looking for comfort and facilities keep searching. Location is great though!

Reviews.Title: “I GOT CONNED FOR Â£500.00”
Reviews.Author: zchops
Reviews.Content: I cancelled my booking prior to 48hrs policy, got a cancellation confirmation from the hotel. they still charged me and now refuse to refund. not only this the manager refused to give me his name and said "do whatever u want, i dont care." he was rude and unprofessional. the only reason i cancelled my booking was because of the terrible reviews it has already and i saw the reviews after i made the booking.

Reviews.Title: “overly priced and unprofessional service...”
Reviews.Author: nubra
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very unprofessional and it looked like a seedy joint. The sink was clogged, mini bar was totally empty, however on arrival we were asked to pay a deposit in case we used the mini bar. We were informed that on weekends the bar is always empty!! The television was not working, and nor was the WiFi though it did mention in the hotel folder that each room was equipped with it..You can not speak to the manager as he is unreachable at weekends and the receptionist informed us that she has not authority to do anything other than check in peopleâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here... Please”
Reviews.Author: Acba10
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our experience mirrors several others on these and other review sites - really wish I'd not been in such a hurry and read them first! We booked an "Executive double room. Breakfast included. Brand new stylishly decorated rooms with King Size bed etc etc". When we arrived we were taken 50yards down the road outside the main hotel and shown a grubby basement room with none of the promised facilities. We complained and were and were given the 'sorry, overbooked but we do have a room of the promised standard in another hotel' story. We went along with this and were taken to the Knightsbridge Green where again the room was standard at best (in a shabby rundown sort of way) without bar or restaurant facilities and being advertised as 4 Star (that's not flattering advertising - it's lying!). Complaints to the manager illicited promised upgrades and reimbursements - I am not holding my breath

Reviews.Title: “The worst in over 50 years of travel”
Reviews.Author: archiebeck
Reviews.Content: dirty, rude, broken window, broken fan in washroom, lying and cheating. Charged extra night. Be good to yourself---stay in a homeless shelter.

Reviews.Title: “For once I forgot to check Trip Advisor ! A major error”
Reviews.Author: Jonesys
Reviews.Content: This place is more akin to a backsreet hostel. Its dirty , scruffy and the food is dire. I just wanted somewhere to rest my head as I would only be in the hotel for 5-6 hours. I would rather have slept on a park bench and given the money to the homeless. Dont even think about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “awfull hotel avoid”
Reviews.Author: nicoledx
Reviews.Content: Me and my mum booked a 2 night stay at this hotel we was told we couldnt have the room we booked as there was some confusion with the payments so they let our room out.. They eventually gave us a suite in there hotel i definately wouldnt call it a suite i felt like i was in a bedsit. The rooms are dark and dingy no nice view just looking out at a yard and an enclosed building site.. The air con didnt wrk very good at all so it was like a sweat box room. The lift broke when i was in it as its very ancient and not safe at all... Had to ask for coffee and teas as the cleaner didnt restock. Ordered fresh fruit for breakfast looked about 2 weeks old. CANT BELIEVE THEY RATE THIS A LUZURY 4 STAR they need the hotel inspector for sure awfull stay feel robbed for my money

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere in London to sleep”
Reviews.Author: stuartwilkinson
Reviews.Content: Booked last minute for a night in London. Actually the room was more spacious than average for the city, cleanly appointed, and quiet. Up on the 6th floor though the hot water system showed the age of the building. Showered in a trickle of lukewarm water. For the price it could have been a bit better. No other amenities that I saw.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: walldanzig
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the Belgravia Mews and after reading the reviews on here I was dreading it. Upon arrival the Belgravia told us they didnt have the twin rooms we booked but they would put us up here. Upon arrival the staff where very friendly jovial and had a laugh with us. The lift gets a mention a lot and yes it was old but it has character and did the job a lift should. I had a twin room with living room it was very clean and the beds where very comfortable. Breakfast came by way of filling in a form and having it delivered at a time that was conveniant to us(which worked perfectly). Cosmeticly there could have been one or two fixes but nothing major. I enjoyed my stay here an wanted to leave a review to balance the bad reviews. For the price I paid Â£65 amazing value. The staff where nothing but helpful and the rooms where clean. I was going to the Pulp gig and needed a clean comfy bed for the night in a great location. I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: susie188057
Reviews.Content: The Knightsbridge Green Hotel in London, close to Harvey Nichols, is the biggest rip-off I have ever encountered in a hotel, and I have traveled all over the world. Everything about my one night stay was awful. The mattress was old, dirty and cheap, and the bathroom was equally disappointing. The refrigerator in the room was empty, and there was no bottled water in the hotel, so the only way to get something to drink was to give money to the one hotel employee so he could go outside the hotel to buy something. Of course, the hotel did not reimburse the second night after I announced I was changing hotels.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL FROM HELL”
Reviews.Author: leahhamill
Reviews.Content: This was ment to be a romantic break away for mysefl and my partner instead we arrived to misrible unfriendly staff on reception who told us our room wasnt ready at 13.00pm. I had to show confirmation of booking that stated room would be ready from 13.00pm to then be shown to a room! Walked up some grotty stairs to our room which had a handle that did not shut properly, Grubby carpet a wooden Four posted double bed which had what looked like a old curtain clipped around the four posts. "We were promised a Luxury Queen size bed in the hotel Confirmation". There were Blood stains on the bed quilt and a shower in the bathroom which did NOT work. I complained about the bed sheets and NOTHING was done i slept on a chair in the room Just when i thought it couldnt get any worse, we were expecting breakfast but the hotel said we couldnt have it unless we paid Â£14 each we had tea and coffee making facilities in the room but no Water or Milk? Asked for Milk took an hour for Rooms service to bring it to us by then we didnt bother having any. The room service lady was a lady we had seen previously cleanning the hotel windows. This is a disgrace i will be expecting a full refund as well as compensation from the owner of this hotel "Ali Farhani". As for the word LUXURY being used i will be reporting this to the trading standards as a trade description act. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible experience - Please AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: iLuvLondon1
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a horrible place to stay. My first complaint is the website, the hotel is misrepresented and mis-advertised. It is 5 mins walk from Harrods but the picture implies the hotel is located at Harrods. The second complaint is the staff were rude, insulting and unhelpful and tried to use every trick in the book to overcharge and add additional charges. Charges were constantly made to our credit card without us being present and we were forced to sign for all charges prior to leaving. Third complaint is that the hotel rooms were in a terrible state, old, dirty and not at all as represented in the photographs on the website. In fact the website is just a template taken from other hotels as I have since seen the same website used for different hotels. The bed was old and uncomfortable. This hotel was not 4* and should not charge more then Â£30 per night instead they charged well over Â£140 for a low quality substandard hotel. Please do not book here again! I would never recommend this terrible place especially for the charges and attitude of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteW87
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks beautiful on the offical website, it caught my eye and I was very much looking forward to staying here. HOWEVER, I soon realised it was completely different. The room had broken fixtures, the decor looked tatty, the 'free wifi' was non-existent, the breakfast was appaulling for the cost and the staff were generally disinterested and not very helpful. To conclude I would never recomend this hotel to anyone and I will defiantly not be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as i thought it was going to be”
Reviews.Author: MLilley
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we realised late Saturday afternoon that we werent going to be able to get back home that evening as the trains werent running normal service. I desperately searched online for a late hotel booking and came across this hotel on laterooms.com Now it was advertised as a Â£850.00 a night room discounted to Â£133.00. Please do not be fooled by this. I thought i had bagged ourselves an absolute bargain but i was soon concerned when i saw all the negative reviews on here. Upon arrival we were "greeted" with a grunt from a foreign gentleman on reception. It appeared that our booking had not been forwarded on to them, so we had a few issues actually checking in. The hotel itself looked ok, but there were signs of wear on the carpets and as mentioned the lift was a bit outdated. Still on getting to our room we were pleasantly surprised. It was clean spacious and modern. Again some signs of wear and a few small easily fixable things, such as the light switch button was missing and there were cables untidly running to the tvs (yes we have 2 televisions, one in the bedroom and one in the lounge area) also the room looked like it had been decorated in a hurry, but overall it was nice. The bed was huge and very comfortable, it was 2 large singles pushed together but it didnt feel like it. The bathroom was clean, which was all my wife was concerned about and the shower although it looked like it might not work was actually very good. We were staying here out of necessity rather than desire, but i would say it was ok. There was no information about breakfast and when we called down to reception to ask about it at 9.15am we were told it finished at 9.30 so we didnt get time to find out what that was like, however i saw a tray being delivered to the room next door of what looked like a continental breakfast that would have been very acceptable. All being said i would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a friendly, well maintained hotel with good facilitiles, but if like us you just needed a reasonably priced night in a hotel that is in an excellent location then it would be ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Lies and false advertising”
Reviews.Author: dyaffe
Reviews.Content: Don't go here. * They claim internet but its only available in a tiny lobby. * The rooms are tiny. * The staff is rude.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel, terrible service, poor quality rooms. DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: jpchalk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently and received an abysmal level of service. When I complained the staff were completely uninterested. Website is inaccurate - don't believe it! Breakfast was a stale croissant and luke warm coffee which they charged Â£14.95 for. Many aspects of the room where broken or inadequate, i.e the iron was supplied with no ironing board and there was no wireless internet! Wish I had looked on trip advisor before booking - DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor service and shabby rooms make it poor value and somewhere we wouldn't recommend.”
Reviews.Author: giraffe100
Reviews.Content: Good points were: the location - short walk to Albert Hall, V & A, Harrods, Harvey Nicols; comfortable and clean twin beds - we had booked a large double; plenty of hot water. The bad points were: the rooms, stairs, lift and corridors that we saw were in need refurbishment - I'm sure the decor was the same as when we stayed there in about 1997/98; we had loads of wardrobe space but only one hanger; tea making facilities and various beverages but no cups; only broken Venetian blinds on the windows -resulting in us being woken early by the light; a shower screen which hung outside of the bath; knobs broken off the electrical switches making them difficult and possibly dangerous to operate; no chairs or mirrors in the bedroom and only a scruffy coffee table to rest everything on; continental breakfast for two was of a poor quality and only served with one plate between us. I dealt with three different people at reception and found them to be either inefficient, unhelpful or rude. At Â£189 per night it was not good value and not as advertised. Â« â€¹ â€º Â»

Reviews.Title: “My breakfast never arrived! We were left starving!”
Reviews.Author: Bubbabells
Reviews.Content: We payed nearly Â£400 to stay 1 night in a penthouse apartment whilst in London on business and even though we stressed the fact that breakfast was incredibly important as we had a whole day of work ahead of us it never arrived!! We rung reception only to be told that because it was a Sunday morning the staff came in late and that was why our breakfast never arrived, we were furious and offered nothing to compensate us. I would never recommend this hotel. Apart from our breakfast drama, we found the suite to be quite shabby and the staff were very rude and unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs !!!”
Reviews.Author: FemaleTraveller0411
Reviews.Content: Despite calling the hotel at 6pm to ask for a late check-in, when I tried to check in at 11pm as a single female traveller I was told "there is a problem with your room" (I was never told what the problem was). I was assured I had been given a room in their "sister" hotel - which I have since found out is not a "sister" hotel but is owned by 'a friend of a friend'. The receptionist assured me they would pay for my taxi to get to the "sister" hotel, which was a 25 minute taxi ride away, but when i got out at the other end the taxi driver knew nothing of the hotel paying the fare, so I had to pay the Â£40 fare myself. Calls/emails to the hotel, go unanswered (for 7 days now). The female receptionist working on the evening of 19th April should be sacked for her unhelpfulness and sheer lack of customer care & attention, if you don't want to work in a customer environment get another job !! The Hotel Manager should also be sacked as he is running a poor excuse for a "luxury hotel". I have stayed at 2* hotels more worthy and deserving of 4* than this joke of a hotel. This hotel should be investigated under the trades description act of the use of the word "luxury" !

Reviews.Title: “Not the hotel you would expect in the location!”
Reviews.Author: darylroots
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cheap hotel in a great location in Knightsbridge this could be the hotel for you... however, if you are expecting a hotel with facilities to match the location look elsewhere. The photos on the hotel's website are inaccurate and our room was very basic, but it did it's job considering we were really only looking for somewhere to rest our heads. In all honesty it wasn't the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, but if you are looking for cleanliness, modern fixtures and polite staff I would reccommend you pick a Travelodge or PremierInn over this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF THEIR WEBSITE-FALSE PROMISES, BAIT AND SWITCH!!”
Reviews.Author: boosie2shoes
Reviews.Content: Oh my! The website of the Knightsbridge Green Hotel looks beautiful (they say luxurious) - photo of a lovely room, internet connection, coffee in your room, knowledgeable staff......NOT TRUE! Our room looked nothing like the photo on the website; there was absolutely NO INTERNET connection for our entire 5 day stay, coffee was available if you had at least 30-45 minutes to spare once you ordered; and, if you asked the staff a question they would look at you like "deer in headlights". NEVER AGAIN!! The location was great but there are plenty of other hotels to stay in within a stones throw.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Marmalizer
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped into the lobby I began to realise I'd made a mistake. Not only had they messed up my reservation telling me they didn't have a room for us, but the receptionist was rude and unhelpful and only 'found' another room when we told her we'd be back to see the manager in person. The room was drab and rundown with worn, cracked lino in the bathroom, chipped paint and threadbare carpets. No cooked breakfast on offer and no fresh coffee. All in all, an unpleasant hotel with unpleasant staff, and the only thing going for it is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull aspect”
Reviews.Author: rafaelcm51
Reviews.Content: Wow... After staying 2 weeks at Base2stay (Kensington) and having to move out (no previews reservation for one more unexpected week), I was shocked with the terrible aspect of Green Hotel. Very old carpets, scary elevator, awful reception... It doesn`t seem professional at all (although I didn`t have any problems with staff, they were always helpful when asked). Really, not the same level as Base2stay... I certainly will look better before choose hotels next time...

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: starlovin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful, the pictures on their website are make believe they are nothing like the real thing, there are cracks in the walls and ceilings and our door had a big chunk missing. There is no double glazing so you can hear everything little thing from the cars to the people chatting outside, currently there are workman on the building next to the hotel which you will hear every hammer hit they make, this will wake you up almost every 30 minutes as it did us. Our door had a big gap underneath so you get a lot of light coming through from the hall way. the walls are also paper thin so you will hear all the conversations going on in the next room. The rooms are stale with funny smells. The staff are not very friendly and you are made to feel like you are disturbing their day. On the plus side the beds are comfy and the location is very good. I will not recommend this to anyone as it is the worst hotel i have ever satyed in.

Reviews.Title: “Others are just pessimistic, the hotel is nice!”
Reviews.Author: MissHelenKF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Knightsbridge Green with my partner for an anniversary night in London. The Hotel looked nice from the outside, the reception area also looked quite appealing, however the staff at first were not as welcoming as they could have been. Our room was on the fourth floor, and it was nicely decorated, bathroom was clean and the windows did have a secondary glazing on them, we had no street noise. The bed was nice and comfy. Overall I think the one problem with the hotel was a cheap refurb, there were signs of bad decorating that had not been done properly but if you dont look too closely and dont inspect every inch of a hotel room then the hotel is good! The location is excellent but the staff need cheering up.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: carolinekelly820
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from a weekend trip to London. We nearly cancelled this hotel after reading some of the awful reviews. I am happy to say we didn't cancel and were very pleasantly surprised by how nice the rooms were and how spacious our particular room was. The room was also spotless and very comfortable, We could not have had a better location as it was 2 mins from Knightsbridge Tube Station which has a direct link to Heathrow. We were also around the corner from Harrods which was an added bonus. I would recommend this hotel for its great location and comfortable spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A very basic, rundown hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnRavenhill
Reviews.Content: Very basic rooms, old cheap fittings, website very misleading, broken cornices in bathroom, old damaged window frames, badly worn stair carpet (looks awful), pixellated digital TV, impossible to watch any channel. In summary, I wont be back. I booked on laterooms, which advertised the room rate at Â£850 per night, discounted to Â£116. Somebody is having a laugh!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really good find”
Reviews.Author: jonseyboy1
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t think anyone has had any complaints about the location here and I donâ€™t blame them. But even so, the hotel could still be classed as a little hidden gem. The front of the building is nicely decorated but it is pretty small and in between a couple of restaurants/bars so you could miss it if you donâ€™t look closely. No point talking about the proximity to everything else, just look at the map. I am not sure what has happened but the reviews on here do suggest an absolute pit, but that really doesnâ€™t look true. There are a couple of small issues, but it certainly didnâ€™t affect my stay and you often get that in an old building such as this. Everything about the room was brilliant. A good size, comfy bed and internet is all I really need and I was really happy staying here for the few nights I did. Would absolutely recommend it and is certainly better in my mind than several bigger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RachG2011
Reviews.Content: The first thing I would say is that the hotel is in a perfect location. A couple of minutes walk if that takes you to the Knightsbridge Tube station and in the other direction to Harrods. Buses also run from right outside the hotel so in my mind, you couldnt be better connected. Now to the hotel, we got a great rate on the internet but even with that we were slightly concerned after coming onto trip advisor to see some of the comments that were left. Still, we needed somewhere to stay and this was right in our budget. The entrance was welcoming with a nice lounge should you like that sort of thing! Although the lift was old, we werent sleeping in there so didnt mind too much. Once we found our room we were I must say, pleasantly surprised that it was very nice. Spacious for such an old building in London, it had everything that you wanted including a comfy bed and a flat screen tv. Bathroom water pressure was great and so there wasnt really anything that I could complain about. I didnt really need to deal with the staff as everything was very straightforward, but when I did speak to them, they were happy, polite and even cracked a couple of jokes. All in all, a great hotel for a very reasonable price, in a superb area. Dont be put off!!

Reviews.Title: “The absolute pits and they refrauded”
Reviews.Author: cassini1
Reviews.Content: I stayed there many times between 2005 and 2010. Changed owners a couple of times. They did some refurbishment which improved the rooms somewhat. I used the hotel simply for sleeping because I wanted to be close to the shops in Knightsbridge. On this occasion I reserved and paid in advance (at their request) some three months before arrival in London. I rang to re-confirm two days before arrival to be told there was no reservation in my name. although I had actually already paid in advance! They offered a much higher rate for the room but they "could not" accept my advance payment although it had been debited from my credit card some two months before. Apparently they had changed ownership in between and could not honour any previous payment as a result. Looks like the previous owners had done a runner! Thankfully the credit card company understood and refunded me in full. I would never ever recommend this hotel again. Needless to state, I did not go there at that time.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - hotel run by scam artists”
Reviews.Author: erin2301
Reviews.Content: This hotel and the staff are extremely dodgy. Concierge from hotel ran minicab scam on us - asked for a taxi and received some random bloke in a van who charged me 15 pound to get from Knightsbridge to Victoria Station. Had no time to argue as would have missed train otherwise. Furthermore there is no free internet as advertised on the website. Don't bother with this dive.

Reviews.Title: “dont waste your money stay at home”
Reviews.Author: clivetidmarsh
Reviews.Content: haveing arrived at this hotel we were told that there was no key to our room , rooms very scruffy , and dirty, no pluge to the bath, then woken by an early morning call at 6am no internet access. The worst hotel ever not worth the money, staff need to be sacked . not 4 star

Reviews.Title: “4 stars for rudeness”
Reviews.Author: Beaufort50
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night. The receptionist will no doubt get the gold medal in 2012 for the rudest receptionist on the planet. Room smelt of cigarette, empty bag on crisps in the cupboard etc...This hotel is everything but a "boutique hotel", best avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ellen1803
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Our room looked nothing like the photos on the hotel website and the 'double bed' was just two singles pushed together. There was no working lift and no electricity for the entire duration of our stay; obviously not the fault of the hotel, but we were not even offered a torch. To top things off we were charged twice for the room and it took the hotel a month to refund the money. The staff were completely indifferent to the matter and lacked any kind of professionalism. Overall, a very disappointing and frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Nicest 4* Hotel Suite I Have Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: Jade044
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about staying at the hotel after reading the reviews, however, my stay was perfect. I booked a single room and they gave me a suite which was very clean, everything worked and the shower was great. The sheets were clean and I slept very comfortably. All of the different staff from the afternoon I arrived until the morning I checked out were very pleasant and helpful. There were many shops and restaurants around the corner as well as the metro and bus. I have stayed in some very bad hotels in Europe and some very nice ones and by comparison this was one of the nicest. Also, the room I had was exactly like the photos on the website.

Reviews.Title: “2 star in a 4 star location”
Reviews.Author: Anissesofia
Reviews.Content: It's hard to describe this place and how bad it is. You have to experience it to believe it. My main gripe is with Last Minute.com, however, who had this on their site as a 'magnificent (their wording has now changed I note) 4 star on their TOP SECRET list. Well, lesson learnt I guess. After booking and finding out where it was, I immediately tried to negotiate a change with Last Minute - to no avail. Their customer service is rubbish. All I'll say is NEVER book a Top Secret with them. Personally, I'll never book anything with them. Anyway, back to the hotel. It seems as if a one-armed, cross -eyed DIY fanatic has been let loose. But there are advantages to this hotel if you can book it cheaply. (1) The rooms are spacious (well the ones I saw, at least) (2) The location is good in the heart of Knightsbridge (3) Room 41 as a single traveller was actually not bad - hilariously bad fit-out, but spacious. Interesting hole in the bathroom ceiling, but big bathroom. Looks over a quiet-ish lane and a building site. But I was up early so this didn't bother me. (4) Don't go for the upgrade suite (the photos they use on the site) - hideous, noisy and dirty as the windows face the internal courtyard with kitchen fans going. Windows also have a fire escape balcony outside which just shouts 'rob me' . I took one look and asked to be moved to the smaller room (41) But don't go with expectations. This place is Fawlty Towers without the fun of John Cleese. The staff have a permanent scowl or look of terror on their faces (everyone is shouting at them). If you are nice to them they will look after you well. It's not their fault the owner is a robber.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Reasonable Price, Call it 2*, Not 4*!”
Reviews.Author: bubblesEastCoast
Reviews.Content: I have to say, things didn't start very well as the room price on the internet neglected to mention the tax so instead of the quoted Â£68, we were charged Â£85. Still, for Knightsbridge that was a fair price. I made a bit of a fuss and we were upgraded to a suite, which was fine. However, the whole place is very tatty and most of the bedroom doors looked like they'd been kicked in at some stage, and there was paint chipped off everywhere. We had a nice sized suite with reasonable bedroom and sitting room overlooking the road but that was fine. Pity it's all such a bodge - evidence of cowboy builders and poor maintenance everywhere - tatty double glazing, dire shower room with mould around the shower tray, surface wiring in places, lamps with the wrong plugs on, curtains not hanging properly - missing hooks? - wonky knackered furniture & so on. The bed was the best bit, large and comfortable. The 'extras' were very 2* with sachets of coffer & UHT, no biscuits for example. Basic dull toileteries, free wi-fi with such a poor signal I couldn't get anything, mini bar sparsely equipped. Breakfast was Â£14 something each extra for a flabby piece of toast and cup of coffee, so we went out and had a feast in a local cafe. In it's favour, we didn't have as bad an experience as other people seem to have done and because of it's price and location, I might even consider going back!

Reviews.Title: “Scam! Hotel doesn't have rooms so move you to a horrible sister hotel so they don't have to refund you”
Reviews.Author: Alitronic
Reviews.Content: Booked the room on lastminute and when we arrived were told that the hotel hadn't received confirmation as the server was down. Some other customers were also being told this. We were told we would be located to their sister hotel, Tophams in belgravia, which is apparently a 4* hotel but was so bad we booked another hotel and checked out early. I complained to lastminute who said they would try and relocate us and would call back within 2 hours. They did but said they couldn't find us a new hotel ad the original hotel had placed u's elsewhere that was supposed to be of the same standard. LM offered me a full refund in the end which was good as it meant I could book somewhere else. It seems that a few other people have had the same issue with the knightsbridge hotel and it's not worth the hassle of booking there.

Reviews.Title: “Scam hotel ''Bumped '' Advertised rooms do not exist.”
Reviews.Author: dasilvafox
Reviews.Content: Where do i start... apart from saying I along with numerous other guests never got past the reception desk, if thats what you can call it. Too scruffy dirty old birds working the desk who look like they had just been dug up issuing abuse and persisently lying about problems with bookings. The pictures of the hotel are total lies, the reception and entry is a scruffy dump. There is a cake freezer and display cabinate in the lounge placed on top of a pallet, yes an industrial pallet, dear oh dear!!! Dirty carpets and dirty walls. We like others where told of a flood in the bedrooms so we couldnt stay, in facts we found out later there were about 16 of us who where bumped to another dump called the Tophams hotel, oh my god, this is just as bad. Tried to get our money back but no chance the scum on the desk just won't refund saying they offered an alternative. Forget the location and dont be fooled. NEVER BOOK THIS EXCUSE FOR A HOTEL. Do not be fooled into booking. It looks like Expedia, Late Rooms the lot of them are in on this, lets face it they get paid their commission one way or another. My suggestion is to stop using the booking sites too, the lot of them useless and me, the poor old customer who parted with his money just got bent over and shafted from behind!

Reviews.Title: “A TOTAL SWINDLE!!”
Reviews.Author: EmilieStampaert
Reviews.Content: After seeing the pictures of the hotel ont the website, my partner and I were really looking forward to oure weekend in London in the Knightsbridge green hotel. It looked like a very nice hotel, 4 stars, everything we wanted! We also paid a lot of money for it, 440 pounds for 2 nights, but since it looked like such a nice hotel, we treated ourselves to a nice christmas weekend in London! Once arrived there, we fell into one disappointment after the other! Not only was the hotel old, and nothing like the pictures on the website, the hotel was fully booked and therefor couldn't give 4!! other customers a room wich they'd already paid for! The receptionist told us she resigned because she was so fed up with having to lie to customers. She also told us we would never see our money back, eventhough the manager would have you fill in a document stating you would be refunded. She admitted it was a total swindle! The next day, after a terrible first night, we went at the lobby to complain, and found us waiting for the manager with 3 other customers! All had complaints, from not working lights in the bedroom, failing elektricity to having cockroaches in the bedroom!!!! The manager dind't show up until 3 hours and half later. She was rude, lied to our face and didn't do anyhting to help us. DON'T EVER BOOK A TRIP TO THIS HOTEL!! IT IS A TOTAL SWINDLE! Emilie Stampaert from Belgium.

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean room. Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: hevtonge
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Green Hotel, Knightsbridge to attend a wedding at the Jumeirah hotel nearby. Didn't want to pay the inflated prices of London so found the Green Hotel for Â£65 a night, bed only. For the price paid, we thought the hotel offered a large (bedroom section and living/chill out section) room which was clean and comfortable. Bedding was soft and we had a nice night's sleep. Service could have been better, and the communal areas could be smarter, but overall, great boutique hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “what a frustrating stay”
Reviews.Author: tecahungria
Reviews.Content: I paid the hotel in advance and when got there, they assigned me a room totally improvised. The hotel description had nothing to do with the room they gave me. Wires all around, dirty carpet, a piece of paper glued in the key holder, all so bad taste and dirty that I felt like complaining. They knew they were delivering something far way from my expectation and proposed to move me to a hotel I don't know where. My stay was supposed to be short so I refused to change hotels once my criteria to choose it was the location. The day after they moved me to a room that was comfortable and cleaner but my stay was already damaged by the discussions I had to have. Worse, when back, I complained to Lastminute.es (the site with whom I booked the trip, and paid in advance) and up to now - mid december 2010 - i didn't receive a reply. I don't recommend either the hotel nor the lastminute deal. They are lovely and very agile when you are booking but to solve problems, they proved to be very slow and incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “More like a minus four hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happyhols051
Reviews.Content: The reception staff at the hotel were completely disinterested, bordering on rude. We were told that the electricity had just run out at the hotel and so the lift didn't work or the telephone system.
