There was no hairdryer in the room (when we are at reception someone was complaining that there wasn't one in their room either). We were asked to complete a breakfast menu that was in the room, except that it wasn't so we had to go back downstairs again to get one. We shouldn't have bothered as breakfast consisted of rubbery old croissants, one knife and plate between 2 of us and some cold toast. When we left the receptionist didn't say a word as we checked out (and I do mean not one word!) She certainly didn't ask us how our stay was, which was probably a good thing. This is not a four star hotel, it isn't even a one star hotel. The whole experience was made worse by the two comedians (except not in a funny way) at the front desk. There is no way in hell I would recommend this hotel to anyone. You'd be better off in Fawlty Towers.

Reviews.Title: “Never again....”
Reviews.Author: rdm34
Reviews.Content: Tatty room, front of house staff were terrible. Good location, but there are plenty of other good hotels in the area, why suffer?

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel , service, and location”
Reviews.Author: alisharobi
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the kg hotel on the 22november I have to stay there a few times and it seems to be getting better year after year I will recommend all my family and friends to go there saw the boss at reception he offered me complimentary breakfast and a free upgrade

Reviews.Title: “Inept, disgusting, unprofessional, uncared for, frankly appalling!!”
Reviews.Author: boonsy641
Reviews.Content: Having travelled extensively, and adorned the corridors of many a good hotel (and to be honest not so good too) the words worst hotel I have ever stayed in easily fall from my lips. Believe me when I say that I do not have to battle with my conscience when writing this review simply because I am extremely happy in stating that this hotel offers little in terms of cleanliness, aptitude, ability, warmth, governance that you can at the very least expect to receive from a well trodden 2 star hotel let alone this reputed 4 star establishment. At your peril you stay at this utter and complete disaster zone of hat I would loosely term a hotel. I cannot even begin to tell the tale. Just take my word for it, stay clear, you will know when you are close by as the smell will hit you. I slept in my clothes thatâ€™s how bad this place is and they still had the cheek to charge me 340 pounds for the night.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare in knightsbridge”
Reviews.Author: tata9901
Reviews.Content: I didn't even stay... I left before the key (which was misplaced at the time of check-in) to my room was brought up. I was in absolute shock when I saw the condition of the room. Gum stained gross carpets, dust piled high on everything, stained sheets and bedding..... disgusting. The tip-off should have been also the fact that they tried to get me to pay extra for the room before I got upstairs, making it seem like my booking was wrong. I paid over 110 pounds.... but you couldn't pay me 110 pounds to stay there. It was the worst dump I've ever seen. To add insult to injury I was told that this room usually goes for 600 pounds a night. They're terrible liars and charletons and rip off artists. Ewww, seriously, pay the extra - stay at a decent place if you at all value your safety, security, sanity and overall health. DON'T STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “a complete disgrace DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Sidms
Reviews.Content: I booked a 1 night stay on the 16th October. I had sent a couple of emails to the hotel voicing my concern but received no reply. I called the hotel 3 days before to confirm my booking and asked fore reassurance that I would not be moved to a sister hotel. On arrival the hotel had no rooms and asked us to move us to their sister hotel as there was no hot water available on the 4th floor. The only reason I booked this hotel was that I needed to be in walking distance of my parents hotel (as I could get a room at my parents hotel) a number of previous guest had also experienced this problem and have written reviews about the hotel moving them to a sister hotel so I was prepared with this possibility. I was insistent that they find me a room so the hotel offered me a single room and therefore not sure where my husband was actually going to sleep, clearly this wasnâ€™t going to be acceptable to me so the guy at reception then said he would throw in complimentary breakfast (like that was going to make a difference) I again said to the guy at reception that he was missing the point. The sister hotel is apparently on 4 mins away however previous guest have said that it is actually 20 minutes away so I really wasnâ€™t prepared to take the risk. I was furious and asked for a refund which I was able to do via speaking to the hotel booking agent. On the basis I was how I was treated I should take it that I had a lucky escape fortunately I was able to get alternative accommodation. Please please do not book this hotel I am normally a really laidback person who doesnâ€™t write review or makes a big issue out of little issues, but believe me you really should not stay at this hotel it is a total disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel gone bad....avoid at all cost for your own safety”
Reviews.Author: bluenoteDublin
Reviews.Content: I had enjoyed staying in this hotel 9 times over the last 5 years. Nothing could have prepared me for the dreadful experience we had this time. Having made a reservation 2 weeks prior to arrival we were shocked to be told extremely rudely that we had no reservation and if we wished to stay the rate had almost doubled!!!! As I was travelling with a friend who was having chemo this was dreadfully upsetting, she was tired after travelling to London and even though we explained this they were adamant that unless we paid the doubled rate we could not have a room . Then luckily a a member of staff recognised us from previous visits and confirmed that we had indeed made a reservation and quoted the number of the room we specifically requested . But due to their mix up it wasnt available until the next night so we accepted a different room on the topfloor The decline in the standards was incredible .The wallpaper was hanging off the corridors, the lift was constantly out of order. The final straw was when our money was stolen from a locked safe in our room!!! We reported it to reception who were totally disinterested, I asked them to call the police and I wished to see the manager/owner. I was left waiting for almost 30 minutes, The owner eventually came to reception, spoke to the Receptionist and walked straight past us. The Receptionist then said " you are allowed to call the police" When the police arrived they were shocked to find there were no security cameras, the bedroom door locks were only ordinary keys, and the safe , although it appeared to work as it "beeped " and flashed the locked light after a credit card was swiped through it actually did not actually lock. We had been totaly fooled into thinking it was secure. Following the police report my insurance company compensated me less the excess so we were still out of pocket . This was an appalling experience our trip was utterly spoiled. Only one member of staff made any effort but she was leaving as everything was put down to " the new owners rules " It is very sad to see what had been a good hotel totally ruined. for your own safety stay somewhere else as it appears that anyone can enter your room andhelp themselves.

Reviews.Title: “dont' book that hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: london2010Geneva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at that hotel for 3 nights and booked 2 rooms (a single and a twin). First incident: they charged the wrong amount on my credit card. Then, when we arrived for check-in at around 2 pm (we asked to check-in at that time) the rooms were not ready and still occupied!!!! Last but not least: the rooms/hotel don't correspond to the pictures we can find on the website. It is supposed to be a 4 stars hotel and the rates are pretty high. The reality is different: holes in the walls in the corridors and bathrooms, no fridge, no hair dryer, noisy, etc... the single room we had on the 6th floor was just a scandal: looked like a spare room (small, dirty, old furniture). We complained and finally could get another one. What does it mean? that if you don't complain, you pay 600 pounds for 3 nights in a ridiculous single room. It's a scandal and I just don't understand that people can run such a business without being disrupted. This is not a 4 stars hotel, and what they sell is not the reality! Will make sure to inform all the people I know about it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even consider staying here........ ever !”
Reviews.Author: howard_and_bec
Reviews.Content: Well what a day. We only had the one day In London, before heading north so we checked on-line at booking.com and reserved a room here for the rate of Â£192. We made our choice mainly based on the location. We arrived about 3pm and after a rather frosty reception by the man at the desk we were told to wait for the Manager. She was only a few metres away on a call with a customer that was due to arrive that day. She was explaining and apologizing that due to a group of 5 overstaying at the hotel, that they had no rooms available. Apparently the guests couldn't be located and as their luggage was open, it couldn't be moved. She told the guest on the telephone, not to worry, and to come as planned as they have alternative rooms at a sister hotel close by. I knew this didn't bide well for my stay, and sure enough, after she got off the phone, I was delivered the same story and apology. Reluctantly I agreed to the other hotel, so she called for a taxi and were on our way. The alternative hotel was the Tophams in Ebury Street which was about a 15 minute journey by cab. When we arrived we found our way to reception, and by this stage I was getting really bad vibes. After being asked to swipe my card for incidentals, we were given a key and lead 100metres up the road to another hotel called the Harcourt. This was when the fun started...... 3 flights of stairs with no assistance, a tiny dark dreary room with no aircomditioning. The room we booked at the Knightsbridge Green had wireless Internet and air-conditioning, neither of which was available at this hotel. At the very very best, this would struggle for a 2 star rating. We made our way back up the road to Tophams so we could at least check our emails etc, and whilst there we checked the reviews on TripAdvisor...... omg ... Why hadn't I checked before making the booking, this hotel regularly overbooks and then shuffles customers to other inferior properies hoping that they just cop it. This along with the very bad feedback on other aspects convinced me that we needed an escape plan. I quickly surfed a few options and found a lovely hotel called the Westbury, which is located In Mayfair. It's a little more expensive, but the room is lovely, the location is great and the staff are friendly. Absolutley positively avoid the Knightsbridge Green. I think a park bench in Trafalgar would be preferable. Ohhhh, and I have asked and emailed twice for a refund but the silence is deafening... rest assured I will contact the credit card company and have them reverse the charge due to non-delivery of services.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanberraIan
Reviews.Content: We arrived in London having to find accommodation for 6 people at short notice as our previous booked apartment had been cancelled by the owner the previous day. We found Knightsbrigde Green online and booked it without reading the reviews as we were not able to find other accommodation that suited our requirements of 3 rooms including single beds for our teenagers. We even rang to confrim the single beds before we booked online and were told they were available. We arrived there within 30 mins. only to be told by the very rude lady at reception that they could only give us double rooms. As this wasn't acceptable to us she offered what she called an 'upgrade'. This was one room with singles and a sofa bed and one bathroom for all of us to share. The room was old and was nothing like the photos on the website, We had asked her not to put the transaction through until we had inspected the alternative room. Instead she went ahead and processed our mastercard anyway, and then had the nerve to tell us it was non refundable. We advised that her upgrade was actually a downgrade and that as she couldn't provide the rooms we had originally booked she had no right to take our money. She illegaly took our money and refused to refund. We left anyway. This hotel overbooks and then offers inferior rooms or sends you to their 'sister' hotel. Don't be fooled - the hotel is nothing like the pictures. It is old with threadbare loose carpet which you could trip over as you enter and also on a noisy busy street. It wouldn't even rate 2 star. They are very dishonest , rude and unfriendly. We saw other guests complaining at the desk too. We wish we had read the reviews first as they are all true!!

Reviews.Title: “It has been 9 years dice our last visit but I will not be going back again.”
Reviews.Author: PItexpat
Reviews.Content: Worn out and disorganised . A shame as the location is wonderful .

Reviews.Title: “Most awful hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: JDvanWyk
Reviews.Content: Nothing like the photos on the website; Staff is not interested in being helpful; the manager is the worst of all; very rude to guests; even confirmed arrangements are not honored; completely overpriced; out of the 5 lights in the room only 1 worked and staff and manger were not interested in helping; wireless internet did not work as advertised on the website and in-room guide and the manger nor the staff did know how to operate it.

Reviews.Title: “All the Bad Reviews Are TRUE”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveller12
Reviews.Content: I thought -- "Only people who have a bad experience write reviews online. I'll give this hotel a chance." Big MISTAKE. Don't be taken in by this place. All the terrible reviews you've read here are absolutely true. We booked 2 rooms at the Knightsbridge Green Hotel, and when we arrived, they originally tried to say that they only received a confirmation for 1 room. I saw the reservation paper in the receptionist's hand though, and it CLEARLY showed us as having reserved 2 rooms, so I was able to confront her on this outright LIE. Unfortunately, they overbooked the hotel, so we had no choice but to stay somewhere else. The lobby was filled with 3 other parties who had ALSO reserved rooms and were ALSO being ousted to other places. The Knightsbridge called us a taxi (one taxi for 4 people with 6 bags of luggage! We had to pack inside like sardines) and the hotel they sent us to was TERRIBLE. It had NONE of the amenities that the Knightsbridge Green Hotel advertised, even though they told us it was their "Sister Hotel". In fact, the place they sent us to denied having ANY affiliation with the Knightsbridge Green. Don't be fooled! These guys are posting low rates online just to sucker people in. They overbook all the time and send guests to other substandard hotels instead. Knightsbridge Green Hotel is the WORST. Save yourself the frustration and book somewhere else! I wish I did.

Reviews.Title: “Never book this Hotel even as a last resort, would not give it 1*”
Reviews.Author: truthfullady_10
Reviews.Content: Firstly booked this hotel at a cost of Â£225 per room as advertised only to be told by the hotel they would not expect my reservation as the price should have been Â£325, they would not budge on the price even though it was their mistake so I agreed. Arrived at the Knightsbridge Green Hotel with a confirmed reservation email only to find that my reservation for 8 rooms had been cancelled. Receptionist not very helpful at all other than phoned their other hotel and they were fully booked. Attitude was very much "tough you sort out yourself where your going to stay" not our problem. The manager was not much help other than he could find us 3 rooms at the hotel and 5 rooms at the Hilton in Wembley (not very close to Knightbridge at all) We were offered 4 rooms at the hotel and suggested we could share, we took the 4 rooms and managed ourselves to book 4 rooms elsewhere. The 4th room no.64 was awful, a single bed, dents in the walls, cracked ceiling, a shower cubicle that do not work at all, walk past kitchen to get to room, looked like the room that the staff stay over in. In general the hotel is not four stars and don't know who in their right mind would give it that rating. Staff attitude was could not care less and to get them to provide cups for tea etc was a trial and 4 hours later cups still left on tables. No bar at hotel but they advertise in their plush folders that beer, wine and spirits is available

Reviews.Title: “needs updating, no hot water, staff not very helpful”
Reviews.Author: England12345
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for one night in May as we were seeing a show, booked the hotel as the rooms looked nice in the pictures however dont be fooled they need updating. First arrived wasnt a very warm welcome, receptionist wasnt overly friendly, on our way to our room we got stuck in the lift as it got stuck between floors had to get off at another level, found our room only two of the light switches worked. The room was clean and tidy though. Next moring half way through shower no hot water and then no water had to wait to be move to another room where the water was piping hot and no cold water and again it just went too cold. All a bit of a nightmare and wasted valuble time changing rooms and waiting around when we could of been seeing the sights of london. Disappointed as no apologies of offer of a discount or anything, staff not really interested.

Reviews.Title: “A sad hotel with no lobby, and depressing rooms”
Reviews.Author: RShera914
Reviews.Content: After an overnight flight, the first thing one wants is a good night's sleep in a comfortable room. The Knightsbridge Green sold us very short. The "lobby" is a depressingly dark hallway leading up to a desk, next to which is an old, creaky elevator with a metal door that slams shut (watch your fingers!). The first room we were shown faced the back of the hotel (we'd asked for a quiet room) but was so dark and dank, it would have been ideal for perhaps, suicide, but not a vacation. The next room was a bit better (at least it got some light), but there was a great deal of traffic noise. If you dare book a room at this hotel, don't expect much (except location), and bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel!! Moved here from Tophams over-booking nightmare.Awful place!!”
Reviews.Author: zoander
Reviews.Content: I had booked a "surprise" trip to London for my boyfriend's birthday for a one night stay at the Tophams hotel. Having read other reviews it seems we were also caught with the repetitive "overbooking" scam!!!. The receptionist is obviously operated by batteries and just repeats "I'm sorry" A taxi was ordered by them to take us to the KG hotel, whilst we were waiting for this another couple arrived to hear the same scenario of "double booked". What a sham!! When we arrived at the KG hotel, first impression was that it was a good location. Reception greeting was flat and unwelcoming, and not a very luxurious looking place either. 4 floors up to our room in what looked like a staff lift that nearly eats your hands and luggage if your'e not careful with the spring loaded door!! Our room was a suite which was quite honestly appalling, tired, old looking, faded, chipped paint on walls, damp wallpaper in bathroom,stains on carpet,filthy dining table,cracked ceiling. 4 star plus rating?? By who?? Our complaint to move was unheard so we had no choice to try and enjoy our 1 night stay, neither hotels were willing to sort out anything as they were both "fully booked" and no manager available to complain to in either. I was told when I complained in the KG hotel to reception "do you realise how much people pay to stay here" Truly disgusting service. Oh, and its incredibly noisy next to the road and there are attractive building sites on either side of the hotel to top it off. Breakfast was a joke, burnt toast and tinned fruit, the quantities ordered were lacking, one glass of juice, 1 plate, 1 knife and napkin between 2! Would never recommend this to anyone, it ruined our stay. In devon where we live this would never happen. Very upset and disasappointed with how we were treated no one in the KG apologised or explained any of the procedures of breakfast or checking out.. I hope this helps someone else before they book to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: Alitaffy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is marketed on the back of a great photo of ONE of their rooms which has been refurbished and they call it a 4* hotel on that particular website, which it most certainly is not. The other rooms haven't been refurbished (they confirmed this when I asked), and are all dull, shabby, tired, old-fashioned and musty. No hot water in the morning (at all) yet no offer of any discount and no reply to my follow-up letter. I wouldn't complain if they'd acknowledged this in some way, but it's the height of terrible customer service to ignore it. Ridiculously expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Moved here from another hotel of the same company.”
Reviews.Author: Schna_BCN
Reviews.Content: Our first choice was The Topham's hotel but when we arrived the Topham's hotel at 10pm we didn't have room. They were overbooked!!!! Never seen that in an Hotel with 2 months ago booked room. They send us to the Knightsbrige green hotel by taxi and until the next days we didn't know exactly if it was in a good location or not. We think it is in good location because is close to Hyde park and Harrods. The hotel looks quite old and forgotten, even for being in a superior room, it looked average clean, no street views, cheap forniture, old bathroom. And we asked for an electric adaptor and they didn't have even one. What to say not a place to recommend but not the worst place of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: Violet2010
Reviews.Content: In June we prepaid for 3 nights at this hotel. In late September, at the end of our trip we landed in London late at night, in the pouring rain, and made it to our hotel only to be told that we didn't have a reservation. We were told that we had prepaid 'the previous owners' and the current owner was not honouring reservations like ours. While the hotel had tried to reach us in the 3 to 4 days before we arrived we had been travelling in Italy and were not checking email. We were offered the only room available at a cost roughly equal to the total amount we had prepaid for 3 nights. We were told that it was our problem to recover the prepaid amount from the previous owner. Needless to say we were very upset and chose to go elsewhere. We are still trying to recover the prepaid amount.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in London”
Reviews.Author: Reston10
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this property for a three-night stay on the tail end of a UK vacation. There is construction and one-way streets around the hotel, so we had some difficulty locating it. There was no parking lot associated with the hotel that we could find. We returned the car to Hertz after dropping off the bags (we parked in a no-parking zone for 30 minutes or so). The front desk called us by name as we were the last guests arriving for the day (mid-day arrival...people must check in early there). The front desk staff was efficient, but not too friendly. Our rate was approximately GBP150/night, which we thought was pretty good for the location and time of year. We were given a room on the 5th floor. It was pretty shabby, and quite different from the photos on the website. It also had two twin beds They have some remodeled rooms, and some dated rooms. We asked to move, and we got a different room that was completely different -- and much more comfortable (plus it had a king bed). The room fixtures and furniture are okay. The bed was very low to the ground. The air conditioning unit worked very well and was quiet. In the evening, the owner's son worked the front desk. He was quite pleasant. The Internet service was out for 2/3 of the days, but eventually fixed. Free wifi. There is no restaurant (although why would you eat in a hotel restaurant in the land of the best Indian food in the world -- perhaps better than India). The location is great if you want to spend time in Knightsbridge, but expect to walk a bit to the tube if you want to go elsewhere. The location is very close to the Mandarin Oriental, and really great high-end shopping. I'm not sure if I'd stay here again -- but it's definitely good value.

Reviews.Title: “An Affordable Gem in Expensive London”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoSue
Reviews.Content: As part of a 2 week trip to England in the summer of 2006, we spent 5 nights in London, at the Knightsbridge Green Hotel. We found the hotel through a combination of TripAdvisor.com and the Karen Brown guide. We were traveling with our 2 children, then 10 and 8, and needed a relatively spacious room without paying $1000 a night. We also wanted a central location and a clean hotel. The KG met and exceeded our requirements on every count. The hotel itself is located in Knightsbridge, 1/2 a block from Hyde Park (perfect for early evening pick-up "football" matches for my husband and son, and for relaxing walks along the lake and runs in the morning). It was also 1/2 block from Harrod's, right on the bus route to Kensington/Portobello Road, and in the othe direction to Trafalger Square/Picadilly/Covent Garden, a block from one of the main Tube lines (the one to Heathrow), and a pretty easy walk to Buckingham Palace and on to Westminster. We always felt very safe. The location simply couldn't have been better. The hotel itself is quite small, so the manager knows all his guests by name and interest. He couldn't have been more helpful in deciding what to do and where to go. The other staff were similarly helpful. Our room ended up being a small suite, with the living room turning into a bedroom each night (with a sofa bed and an added cot - great to avoid sibling squabbles). The bath was spacious, full of marble and very clean. By London standards, it was very reasonably priced - especially for the amount of room we had! Although this isn't a luxury hotel with tons of activities and other services, it was perfect for what we needed during our stay in London - a clean and comfortable place to spend the night in a terrific location and for a very reasonable (by London's outrageous standards) price. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westielover
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my granddaughter for three nights, primarily because it was less expensive than the hotels my husband & I usually stay in, but also because it was an excellent location. We had Room 55 on the top floor and were very satisfied. I have read other reviews that said it was noisy, but we found the double windows (not double paned, but actually two windows, one inside the other) shut out a good portion of the noise if you can keep them closed. I think the lack of noise was also due to the fact that we were on the top floor. The room itself was quite large, which was especially nice with a teenager, but as noted by others, could stand updating. But one of the things we liked was that the bathroom was quite large and the sink was large enough to hold both our toiletries bags, so we weren't fighting for space. The staff was always very helpful and nice. The only thing I objected to was the price of the breakfast, which was Â£7.50 per person. At the present exchange rate that was just about $15 per person, for a continental. It was Â£12 for full English breakfast, & I refused to pay that. While I could get by with checking my e-mail only about once a week while we were gone, my granddaughter, of course, had to be on the computer (theirs) for at least an hour every day. At that time they charged extra for that. We had the same experience as others with the air, getting a weird smell from the air conditioner, so we turned that off & they sent up a fan that we used periodically, because we couldn't stand the noise of the fan all the time. Generally speaking, however, I was satisfied & would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: westphillyboy
Reviews.Content: If you want a quaint hotel in a good location, this is your place. It is conveniently located to busses & metro. The front desk were very nice and helpful. They had just installed wi-fi, when we got there. It worked well albeit very expensive. Room size was quite large. Cons: The hotel was old and really needed rehab. Hallways smelled stuffy. Air conditioning was essentially non-existent. Consider yourself warned if you go in the summer. Overall stay was OK. but I would stay in a more modern hotel with more amenities, next time

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Amy Bradley
Reviews.Content: My family had stayed at this hotel 10 years ago and had a wonderful time. Unfortunately, the hotel has become fairly run down since then. Our room was cheaply furnished, faced a noisy air well, had an air conditioner that barely worked and we could easily hear the occupants of the next room. The service was pretty good, but nothing exceptional. The location is great, but I would never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but air conditioning?”
Reviews.Author: Trip Advisor from Dallas, TX
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here 4 nights in mid June, 2006. The night that we checked in was the hottest June 12 on record in London. We had a 2 bedroom suite, but the air conditioner was only in 1 room -- the room with the sofa & tv, not the bedroom. The bedroom was very hot. We then asked for a fan & all of the fans had been checked out. Our first night was rather hot & uncomfortable. Fortunately, the next day the weather changed & the remainder of our stay had very cool weather so the air conditioning was not a problem. I booked this hotel because of the reasonable rates & location in a very expensive London. If you are staying here in July or August when the weather is hot, you may want to consider another hotel if air conditioning is important to you. Otherwise, this is a great choice for a wonderful location & the price is certainly right. I would stay here again if our stay were in the months when air conditioning is not important.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: innerme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Knightsbridge Green hotel in late March/early April 2006. I booked a "suite" because we were to be there for 9 nights. The extra sitting room made a huge difference in comfort for that long a time, and we were able to have this space for a quite reasonable amount of money. My goal was to book a room for not more than US$250. and I was able to here. Actually the sofa in the sitting room pulled out to a sofa bed, so more than two could stay in this room. The hotel is in a super location; a two minute walk to the Piccadilly line, bus route right outside the door, walking distance to the Victoria & Albert Museum, Natural History Museum, etc. and many restaurants. Also across from Hyde Park. The room was quite comfortable; bed was great, tv was in the sitting room, (I like this) bathroom good size, shower great, towels fluffy (bathrooms are very important to me) People working at the hotel were quite helpful, they stored our luggage for two days when we left to tour around, and booked us a reasonably priced cab to the airport when we had to leave. We took the tube to the hotel when we arrived in London; a very easy ride. We enjoyed staying here and would again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend the last two nights of a two week trip to Italy in London as he would be returning to Iraq and I would be returning to the states. I booked our room (2 person jr. suite queen size bed) in November for the two nights and when I received our confirmation it only included one night, so I immediately emailed them back and they responded by correcting the reservation for two nights. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that there was a problem with our reservation and they would not have our room available for the second night, but they would put us in a larger suite for the first night and a smaller room for the second plus give us a discount. It was around 7 at night so we agreed, not knowing what we were geting ourselves into. The first night was perfect and we loved the location of the hotel. When we went to move into the other room the following morning we found a twin size bed ( my husband is 6 foot and 240 pounds). My husband argued with the front desk three times that morning, but they wouldnt do anything, it seemed more appropriate to inconvenience us whom had made our reservations in November than the person who had made their's since. the front desk's reponse was that "You Americans do everything bigger" in reference to the bed size. We pondered switching hotels, but this was to be our only day to see the sights. Keep in mind this was my husbands and my last night together before he went back to Iraq - so they wheeled us up a fold-away bed - how romantic. it of course broke and my husband ended up sleeping on the floor. The only thing they did do right was to end up not charging us for the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hospitable Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an hotel with a difference. The staff are friendly and helpful, and very professional. The hotel itself is unpretentious, as reported in several previous reviews, but it has a charm of its own. The room I had was extremely comfortable. It was at the front but I wasn't bothered by the traffic noise. Where it really scores is on value, in a town which is about as expensive as a traveler can find. Breakfast is only available in your room as there is no restaurant. In my case it was delivered right on the time I requested. The location is fantastic.

HotelInfo.Name: Knightsbridge Green Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 159 Knightsbridge, London SW1X 7PD, England
